entity.description: First king of the Tuatha D√© Danann, the divine tribe who brought magic and civilization to Ireland. Nuada lost his hand in battle against the Fir Bolg, rendering him unfit to rule by Celtic law. Restored to kingship by a magical silver hand crafted by the divine physician Dian C√©cht, he embodies sovereignty, justice, martial prowess, and the sacred bond between ruler and land.

mythology_stories.intro: Nuada shows strong connections to other Indo-European sky/sovereignty gods:

relationships.allies: All theTuatha D√© Danann, especially theDagda(his chief advisor),Lugh(who he recognized as champion),Dian C√©cht(who healed him), Goibniu the Smith, Ogma
relationships.enemies: The Fomorians (especially Balor who killed him), Bres (the tyrannical half-Fomorian king), Sreng of the Fir Bolg (who wounded him)

family.parents: Son of Echtach, grandson of Etarlam (genealogy varies in sources)
family.consorts: Macha (in some traditions, one of the war goddesses)
family.children: Various sources mention different offspring; some associate him with ancestral lines of later Irish heroes
